name: Chicken Shirataki Honey Ginger
description: This Chicken Shirataki Honey Ginger recipe is a delicious blend of high-protein and low-carb ingredients, perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy meal without sacrificing flavor. With a savory mix of chicken thigh, fresh veggies, and a hint of sweet honey and zesty ginger, it's ideal for those following a low-sodium and low-sugar diet. Dive into this healthified culinary creation that not only nourishes your body but also satisfies your taste buds with each bite.
recipeIngredient: 1  tsp ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the Whole Dried Shitake in warm water until softened, then slice thinly.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the Capsicum, Red and Yellow, Raw into small pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the Chicken Thigh Skinless Boneless into bite-sized chunks.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, heat some oil over medium heat and cook the chicken chunks until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sliced Dried Shitake, diced Capsicum, grated Ginger, Honey, and Ground Black Pepper to the pan. Stir well to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the pan, reduce the heat to low, and let the chicken simmer with the vegetables and seasonings until fully cooked and flavors meld, about 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Chicken Shirataki Honey Ginger hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper or chopped herbs if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
